intro: Memecylon scutellatum, commonly known as the shield-leaf memecylon, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs characterized by their often aromatic wood and compound leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in panicles, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are often yellow or orange when mature. Memecylon scutellatum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
